data.title: Units move to adjacent cells when clicking on the same spot again
data.body: This happens in groups and is easily visible when ordering them to a location nearby. Don't move the mouse, order a move again and they will move someplace else. Not sure when this was introduced and why this happens. However it conflicts with my idea of #3923.

data.title: Assign numbers to spawning points in map preview
data.body:
While in game lobby, it is difficult to tell a player to choose a certain spawning point since they don't have any indication. It would be better if each spawning point had a unique number in the map preview.

![spawn_num](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/6599106/2369832/129d7494-a7ec-11e3-94a5-8d31f5593c3a.png)

And also along with color, faction and team, the chosen spawn number could be shown for each player so that it is easier to see which player chose which spot and who hasn't chosen any, without the need for hovering the mouse cursor over the spawning spots.

data.title: Chronotank group teleportation
data.body: Removed and reopened elsewhere.

data.title: Added async map download with proper error handling
data.body:
As discussed in #3275 this will fix #4324 and look better. We also now give instructions on how this magic works instead of crashing with KeyNotFound when the map has not yet been uploaded to http://resource.openra.net.

Good test cases are
- 185.24.221.192:1239 `ra@bleed` (map not present)
- 178.63.32.174:1220 `ra@git-1079f37` (available custom map)
- 178.63.32.174:1321 `cnc@git-1079f37` (available custom map)

data.title: Moved mirror selection to the client
data.body: This eliminates our last bottleneck https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRAWeb/blob/master/content/get-dependency.php and makes moving the then completely static website elsewhere possible. It also appreciates our bandwidth donors by displaying at least their domain name  #3904.

data.title: Update max players info when player slots are closed?
data.body:
If i want to have 2v2 game on 8v8 map, new people just keep joining because they see that its filled only 4/16.

Would be nice if the max players would update when you close/open player slots.

data.title: Helicopter disappears at the top edge of the map
data.body:
Helicopters can hide at the top edge of the map completely and they are only visible through their shadow on the ground.

![heli](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/6599106/2367880/1575bd1a-a784-11e3-8266-f7ed6217acaf.png)

This is probably caused by the perspective of the view. Maybe map edges could be extended by a couple of tiles, or maps could have a thin layer at the edges that are visible but not maneuverable. Or the units at the edge could be drawn on top of the shroud. Because shroud outside the map is different than the one inside, it can't be uncovered. Or outside shroud could have different color, which would also help see the map edges at the beginning of the game...
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1436828-helicopter-disappears-at-the-top-edge-of-the-map?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: C&C build palette tooltip does not take low power slowdown into account
data.body:
See

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/756669/2367762/e99fb196-a779-11e3-833c-5982980eca59.png)

compared to

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/756669/2367768/352ad8f2-a77a-11e3-8586-a67242975607.png)

extra points for using the power state color (red/orange/green) not always red.

data.title: Implement voice chat
data.body:
Wouldn't it be better to be able to talk to team players via microphone like in FPS games, instead of typing? I don't know if this would be possible considering online game already lags much too often even without sending and receiving voice data. But maybe in the future when the network performance of the game increases this could be an option. This feature would make team-play much more fluid and coordinated. This could even be made part of the gameplay. For example voice chat could be a capability provided by the radar dome. And destroying it could disable voice chat for that player. Or infiltrating radar dome with a spy could give the player ability to listen to enemy radio.

Maybe Mumble could be integrated into the game:
http://mumble.sourceforge.net/

data.title: Set unit/structure build time when building starts instead of when added to queue
data.body:
The build time for a unit/structure was previously set at the time that
item was added to a production queue. This meant modifiers of the
production time (multiple production facilities in ClassicProductionQueue
or "instant build" in debug) were not applied to items already in a queue.

This change modifies ProductionQueue so that build time is set at the
instant an item starts building (reaches the front of it's queue). This was
done primarily to make the production bonuses in ClassicProductionQueue
more apparent, though it also makes the "instant build" debug option more
responsive when items are queued prior to enabling.

While I was affraid that there will occure conflicts, I had reforked OpenRA and made clean push. Please dont blame me; until next time I will lern git documentation.

data.title: Fix #4350 - Spy not disappearing
data.body: Spy now calls .Destroy() and is removed from minimap upon infiltration

data.title: wave files in music player, time displayed wrong.
data.body: Not sure if this is a huge deal since we don;t actually use wav music files but i was messing around and came across this issue. The time of the track is displayed as 486:41 and the seconds counter counts faster than actual seconds.

data.title: MCV unable to move or redeploy
data.body:
upon starting a game with Ripley, wherein he picked GDI and I picked Any, on earth scar, my MCV was incapable of movement in any way. I could order it to move, but while the unit would give a voice response would not follow any move command or any Ctrl + click or A-move. Pressing X for scatter also proved useless.

I had spawned in the top right corner of the map by choice, whilst Ripley had spawned in the bottom left corner, again, by choice.

data.title: Cursor improvements
data.body: Adds a new/improved set of TD cursors, cleans up some Attack\* plumbing, and adds a cleaned up version of the outside-range cursor changes from #4743.

data.title: Aircraft facing jittery in some directions
data.body:
When flying in certain directions, aircraft jitter heavily between two facings, which is rather annoying to look at.

This is probably happening because the aircraft has less available facings than there are directions and in some cases the engine has trouble to decide which facing frame corresponds best with the exact flight direction, switching back and forth between the two closest facings.

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1435854-aircraft-facing-jittery-in-some-directions?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Unit facings not in line with original games
data.body:
I know this is technically Westwoods fault for using such weird facing, but it's still rather noticeable in some cases.

Basically, for example for units with 32 facings, WW used the 4th frame when moving NW, 14th for SW, 20th for SE, 30th for NE, instead of 5,13,21,29 like OpenRA.

The problem is that Westwoods SHPs were made with their odd approach in mind, not the technically correct approach OpenRA is using. I believe some older versions of OpenRA actually took this into consideration, but some of the refactoring seems to have removed that.

This is most noticeable when watching harvesters harvest ore/tiberium, because their facing and harvest animation are not fully aligned visually.

data.title: coin toss or dice roll
data.body: add a "coin toss" or "dice roll"-command  for the lobby-chat to give a random effect on "unbalanced" maps ( specially for tourny games , winner choose spots first)

data.title: Redefined stances
data.body:
A proposal for some changes to stances for discussion. Hold fire and return fire remain unchanged.
- Hold fire - Don't react automatically to enemy units.
- Return fire - Open fire on the source of any damage, never move. Default stance for stealth units.
- Hold ground - Open fire on anything that enters range, never move. Default stance.
- Defend - Scan for targets in an area up to n cells beyond the unit's range from its starting point, move to attack any targets found, return to the starting position when the unit is destroyed or has moved. Default stance for AI.
- Pursue - Scan for targets in an area up to n cells beyond the unit's range from its current position, move to attack any targets found.

Are there too many stances currently? Would the Defend stance as defined here be more useful than the current AttackAnything stance? Should the default stance for stealth tanks be hold fire, and return fire for snipers?
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1435583-redefined-stances?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
